gw.xml

Class XmlBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.xml.XmlBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGosuObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    XmlElement, XmlTypeInstance

    public abstract class XmlBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGosuObject
    The base of all XmlElements and XmlTypeInstances. Provides common methods to both, by delegating to the type instance.

      • getAttributeValue

        public final java.lang.String getAttributeValue(java.lang.String attributeName)
        Returns the string value of an attribute in the null namespace by local name. This may or may not be the same value that will eventually be serialized, such as in the case of QNames, IDREFs, and other special purpose simple types.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - The local name of the attribute in the null namespace
        Returns:
        the string value of the attribute, or null if the attribute is not set

      • getAttributeValue

        public final java.lang.String getAttributeValue(javax.xml.namespace.QName attributeName)
        Returns the string value of an attribute by QName. This may or may not be the same value that will eventually be serialized, such as in the case of QNames, IDREFs, and other special purpose simple types.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - The attribute name
        Returns:
        the string value of the attribute, or null if the attribute is not set

      • setAttributeValue

        public final java.lang.String setAttributeValue(java.lang.String attributeName,
                                 java.lang.String value)
        Sets the string value of an attribute in the null namespace by local name. The attribute will lose any special simple type treatment, such as QName or IDREF handling, and will be serialized exactly as set by this method.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - The local name of the attribute in the null namespace
        value - The new string value of the attribute, or null to remove the attribute
        Returns:
        the old string value of the attribute, or null if the attribute was not previously set

      • setAttributeValue

        public final java.lang.String setAttributeValue(javax.xml.namespace.QName attributeName,
                                 java.lang.String value)
        Sets the string value of an attribute by name. The attribute will lose any special simple type treatment, such as QName or IDREF handling, and will be serialized exactly as set by this method.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - The name of the attribute
        value - The new string value of the attribute, or null to remove the attribute
        Returns:
        the old string value of the attribute, or null if the attribute was not previously set

      • getChild

        public final XmlElement getChild(javax.xml.namespace.QName qname)
        Returns the direct child element with the specified name, or null if no such direct child element exists.
        Parameters:
        qname - The name of the child element
        Returns:
        the direct child element with the specified name
        Throws:
        MultipleContentMatchesException - if there are multiple direct children with the specified name.

      • getChild

        Returns the direct child element with the specified local name in the null namespace, or null if no such direct child element exists.
        Parameters:
        name - The local name of the child element in the null namespace
        Returns:
        the direct child element with the specified name
        Throws:
        MultipleContentMatchesException - if there are multiple direct children with the specified name.

      • removeChild

        public XmlElement removeChild(javax.xml.namespace.QName qname)
        Removes the direct child element with the specified name if it exists.
        Parameters:
        qname - The name of the child element to remove
        Returns:
        the direct child element that was removed, or null if no action was taken
        Throws:
        MultipleContentMatchesException - if there are multiple existing direct children with the specified name.

        Parameters:

      • getText

        public final java.lang.String getText()
        Returns the text content. This might not be the same text content that will actually be written at serialization time due to special serialization-time handling of some simple types, such as xsd:QName or xsd:IDREF.
        Returns:
        The text content

      • setText

        public final void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the text content. This string value will be output verbatim at serialization time, removing any special serialization-time special simple value handling, such as xsd:QName or xsd:IDREF that previously existed, if any. Calling this method with a null parameter will remove any existing text contents or simple values, if any.
        Parameters:
        text - The new text content, or null to remove the existing text content

      • getMixedContent

        public final java.util.List<IXmlMixedContent> getMixedContent()
        Returns the mixed content of this element.
        Returns:
        the mixed content of this element
